channel.title: Omnibus
channel.description: Twice a week, Ken Jennings and John Roderick add a new entry to the OMNIBUS, an encyclopedic reference work of strange-but-true stories that they are compiling as a time capsule for future generations.
channel.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks
channel.itunes:keywords: podcast, Omnibus, Omnibus Project, history, time capsule, Ken Jennings, John Roderick, Jeopardy, The Long Winters
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Omnibus Time Capsule Project with Jennings and Roderick
channel.itunes:summary: Twice a week, Ken Jennings and John Roderick add a new entry to the OMNIBUS, an encyclopedic reference work of strange-but-true stories that they are compiling as a time capsule for future generations.

item.title: Mary Anning (Entry 050.PS3420)
item.description: In which a working-class woman becomes one of the greatest scientists of her age, discovers dinosaur poop, and sells seashells by the seashore. Certificate #36073.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which a working-class woman becomes one of the greatest scientists of her age, discovers dinosaur poop, and sells seashells by the seashore. Certificate #36073.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: S.S. United States (Entry 1213.JB0926)
item.description: In which an aluminum-heavy cruise liner falls on hard times, and John and Ken can't decide if 'Blue Riband' is actually French or not. Certificate #39390.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which an aluminum-heavy cruise liner falls on hard times, and John and Ken can't decide if 'Blue Riband' is actually French or not. Certificate #39390.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Rubber Barons (Entry 1087.EZ1613)
item.description: In which Ken describes the nouveau riche of the Amazon rainforest, and John has a conspiracy theory about scarecrows. Certificate #25284.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which Ken describes the nouveau riche of the Amazon rainforest, and John has a conspiracy theory about scarecrows. Certificate #25284.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Father Coughlin (Entry 284.MT2309)
item.description: In which a fiery Canadian gets 30 million Depression-era listeners for his little fascist radio show, and Ken and John pledge fealty to Martian invaders. Certificate #29423
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which a fiery Canadian gets 30 million Depression-era listeners for his little fascist radio show, and Ken and John pledge fealty to Martian invaders. Certificate #29423
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: The Noid (Entry 840.PR0415)
item.description: In which a claymation terrorist with inexplicable bunny ears disrupts pizza, takes hostages, and wins America's heart. Certificate #29250
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which a claymation terrorist with inexplicable bunny ears disrupts pizza, takes hostages, and wins America's heart. Certificate #29250
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: The Zuider Zee (Entry 1458.NA0104)
item.description: In which the Dutch battle their oldest enemy: the Waterwolf. Almost certainly the Omnibus's last entry (alphabetically). Certificate #31078.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which the Dutch battle their oldest enemy: the Waterwolf. Almost certainly the Omnibus's last entry (alphabetically). Certificate #31078.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: London Bridge Is Down (Entry 733.2K0934)
item.description: In which we make plans for the longest-awaited death in human history, and wonder how many Welsh corgis it takes to pull a gun carriage. Certificate #34884.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which we make plans for the longest-awaited death in human history, and wonder how many Welsh corgis it takes to pull a gun carriage. Certificate #34884.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Back Masking (Entry 091.EP0427)
item.description: In which John investigates whether or not segassem terces naitnoc sgnos kcor, and Ken wonders why Satan would own a toolshed. Certificate #47448
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which John investigates whether or not segassem terces naitnoc sgnos kcor, and Ken wonders why Satan would own a toolshed. Certificate #47448
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Megafauna (Entry 772.JB4015)
item.description: In which we learn which Ice Age animal is named after the human nipple, and which modern animal fills John's soul with bloodlust. Certificate #30148
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which we learn which Ice Age animal is named after the human nipple, and which modern animal fills John's soul with bloodlust. Certificate #30148
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Oneida (Entry 866.MT2230)
item.description: In which a socialist preacher invents a tricky birth control technique he calls 'male continence,' leading directly to the lazy Susan and the assassination of an American president. Certificate #34322.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which a socialist preacher invents a tricky birth control technique he calls 'male continence,' leading directly to the lazy Susan and the assassination of an American president. Certificate #34322.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: The Bellamy Salute (Entry 112.HE0616)
item.description: In which Ken blames a crucial bit of fascist iconography on the most successful magazine premium in American history, and John knows the lyrics to 'Alaska's Flag' but refuses to sing it. Certificate #37863.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which Ken blames a crucial bit of fascist iconography on the most successful magazine premium in American history, and John knows the lyrics to 'Alaska's Flag' but refuses to sing it. Certificate #37863.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Hat Etiquette (Entry 571.1C1104)
item.description: In which John strongly admonishes future listeners not to get sloppy with their headwear, if they have heads. Certificate #25200.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which John strongly admonishes future listeners not to get sloppy with their headwear, if they have heads. Certificate #25200.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Death Discs (Entry 319.MK1610)
item.description: In which the gruesome deaths in early 1960s teen ballads are variously blamed on capitalism, Marlon Brando, chastity, and giant clams. Certificate #34312.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which the gruesome deaths in early 1960s teen ballads are variously blamed on capitalism, Marlon Brando, chastity, and giant clams. Certificate #34312.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Mutual Assured Destruction (Entry 820.JE5022)
item.description: In which the human race barely survives the 20th century. (Well, not all of it, obviously. Picasso didn't, for example.) Certificate #27008
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which the human race barely survives the 20th century. (Well, not all of it, obviously. Picasso didn't, for example.) Certificate #27008
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Mummy Brown (Entry 817.PR0716)
item.description: In which the bodies of ancient kings are ground up to fertilize lawns, power locomotives, and paint portraits. Certificate #37891
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which the bodies of ancient kings are ground up to fertilize lawns, power locomotives, and paint portraits. Certificate #37891
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Thomas Midgley (Entry 786.ZC0508)
item.description: In which the world's worst chemist gives everyone lead poisoning, and then puts a hole in the ozone layer as an encore. Certificate #25185
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which the world's worst chemist gives everyone lead poisoning, and then puts a hole in the ozone layer as an encore. Certificate #25185
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Paris Syndrome (Entry 901.JS1002)
item.description: In which twenty tourists a year have a psychological breakdown because the most magical city in the world is a little disappointing. Certificate #507
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which twenty tourists a year have a psychological breakdown because the most magical city in the world is a little disappointing. Certificate #507
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: The Sentinelese (Entry 1134.LV2024)
item.description: In which John introduces us to the world's last uncontacted tribe—but not literally, because that would be illegal. Certificate #13568
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which John introduces us to the world's last uncontacted tribe—but not literally, because that would be illegal. Certificate #13568
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Kohoutek (Entry 692.JU0113)
item.description: In which a Czech astronomer is hailed as the hero of 1973, only to have his discovery flame out by not flaming out. Then he gets very seasick on a cruise. Certificate #31644
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which a Czech astronomer is hailed as the hero of 1973, only to have his discovery flame out by not flaming out. Then he gets very seasick on a cruise. Certificate #31644
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Monrovia, Moravia, Moldova, Moldavia (Entry 805.GN1032)
item.description: In which John shares the soothing geographic mantra that has got him where he is today: sitting in a bunker teaching 30th-century cockroach-people how to tell medieval Central European principalities apart. Certificate #18088.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which John shares the soothing geographic mantra that has got him where he is today: sitting in a bunker teaching 30th-century cockroach-people how to tell medieval Central European principalities apart. Certificate #18088.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Heil Honey I'm Home! (Entry 577.PR1413)
item.description: In which an upstart British television producer finally answers that age-old question: why don't more classic sitcoms star Adolf Hitler? Certificate #42615.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which an upstart British television producer finally answers that age-old question: why don't more classic sitcoms star Adolf Hitler? Certificate #42615.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: The Darien Gap (Entry 315.EZ3328)
item.description: In which a single highway is paved all the way from Alaska to Argentina--except for one pesky 66-mile gap right in the middle. Certificate #11458.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which a single highway is paved all the way from Alaska to Argentina--except for one pesky 66-mile gap right in the middle. Certificate #11458.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Secret Order of the Double Sunrise (Entry 1122.EC0105)
item.description: In which QANTAS begins a top-secret 33-hour nonstop flight between Australia and Ceylon at the height of World War II, right under the noses of the Empire of Japan. Certificate #12248.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which QANTAS begins a top-secret 33-hour nonstop flight between Australia and Ceylon at the height of World War II, right under the noses of the Empire of Japan. Certificate #12248.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Newton's Cradle (Entry 835.1C1311)
item.description: In which thousands of soulless corporate executives put little steel toys on their desks but still feel dead inside, and Ken finally learns how those little drinking birds work. Certificate #31932.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which thousands of soulless corporate executives put little steel toys on their desks but still feel dead inside, and Ken finally learns how those little drinking birds work. Certificate #31932.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Gadsby (Entry 511.PS6928)
item.description: In which our two hosts study a book that runs fifty thousand words without a solitary display of our writing plan's fifth symbol. Certificate #6442.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which our two hosts study a book that runs fifty thousand words without a solitary display of our writing plan's fifth symbol. Certificate #6442.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Water Wars (Entry 1414.PS6301)
item.description: In which Los Angeles stands revealed in all its unquenchable thirst, and is pronounced by John and Ken several times the fun, old-timey way, with a hard 'g'. Certificate #33935.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which Los Angeles stands revealed in all its unquenchable thirst, and is pronounced by John and Ken several times the fun, old-timey way, with a hard 'g'. Certificate #33935.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: The Tesseract (Entry 1291.EP0318)
item.description: In which Ken and John struggle to imagine four-dimensional space with the same ease that the inventor of the pitching machine once could. Certificate #28910.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which Ken and John struggle to imagine four-dimensional space with the same ease that the inventor of the pitching machine once could. Certificate #28910.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: The Rachel (Entry 1024.GN2917)
item.description: In which John opines that Jennifer Aniston's ubiquitous 1990s-era cut was America's 'last hairstyle.' Certificate #24193.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which John opines that Jennifer Aniston's ubiquitous 1990s-era cut was America's 'last hairstyle.' Certificate #24193.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Smell-O-Vision (Entry 1177.AM0521)
item.description: In which the aromas of tobacco, coffee, and lavender, meant to revolutionize the motion picture industry, end up nauseating audiences instead, and Ken spoils a 57-year-old surprise cameo. Certificate #18585.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which the aromas of tobacco, coffee, and lavender, meant to revolutionize the motion picture industry, end up nauseating audiences instead, and Ken spoils a 57-year-old surprise cameo. Certificate #18585.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: The Pig War (Entry 939.MK0511)
item.description: In which the United States and Britain take up arms over one potato-hungry pig. Certificate #43259.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which the United States and Britain take up arms over one potato-hungry pig. Certificate #43259.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: The Olympic Marathon of 1904 (Entry 865.1C0924)
item.description: In which the world's most prestigious sporting event goes disastrously wrong, and a Cuban mailman takes a nap. Certificate #28924.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which the world's most prestigious sporting event goes disastrously wrong, and a Cuban mailman takes a nap. Certificate #28924.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Defenestration (Entry 326.2K0933)
item.description: In which throwing people out of windows is strongly endorsed by many hot-headed Czechs, but opposed in no uncertain terms by Ken's great-great-great-great-grandfather. Certificate #32146.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which throwing people out of windows is strongly endorsed by many hot-headed Czechs, but opposed in no uncertain terms by Ken's great-great-great-great-grandfather. Certificate #32146.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: The European Starling (Entry 431.PS8403)
item.description: In which an eccentric Shakespeare buff releases two birds in Central Park, and thereby screws up an entire continent's ecosystem. Certificate #27603.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: In which an eccentric Shakespeare buff releases two birds in Central Park, and thereby screws up an entire continent's ecosystem. Certificate #27603.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: The Omnibus Project
item.description: Ken and John provide a time capsule of whimsical recordings for future generations, commemorating the human race's triumphant achievements and its beautiful mundanities.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken and John provide a time capsule of whimsical recordings for future generations, commemorating the human race's triumphant achievements and its beautiful mundanities.
item.itunes:author: HowStuffWorks

item.title: Omnibus: Trailer
item.description: Twice a week, Ken and John add a new entry to the OMNIBUS, an encyclopedic reference work of strange-but-true stories that they are compiling as a time capsule for future generations.
item.author: applepodcast@howstuffworks.com (HowStuffWorks)
